items.content:
Assistant Assigning Editor – Insurance at NerdWallet

Remote

Location: San Francisco, CA or Remote (based in the U.S.)

NerdWallet is looking for an assistant assigning editor with an entrepreneurial spirit. This is a non-managerial role, but successful AAEs may be candidates for future management positions on our content team.

To be a successful Assistant Assigning Editor at NerdWallet, you must:

  • Be passionate about helping readers and ensuring that NerdWallet’s articles are consistently engaging, clear, and actionable
  • Edit consistently at a high level, demonstrating expertise at not only grammar and style but also at a big-picture level
  • Be comfortable with change and constructive criticism
  • Work with equal enthusiasm whether you’re leading a project or working within a team
  • Be able to handle challenging conversations effectively
  • Collaborate well with writers and other editors

That’s part of what it takes to thrive at NerdWallet, where we guide consumers on a broad range of financial topics, including credit cards, banking, personal loans, student loans, mortgages, insurance, and investing.

Our content team is 80+ strong and includes writers and editors with experience from Bloomberg, Dow Jones, the Los Angeles Times, MSN, Reuters, USA Today, The Wall Street Journal and The Washington Post.

What we have in common: We take initiative. We think strategically. We problem-solve effectively. We’re adaptable. We’re highly collaborative.

Where you can make an impact:

  • Understand SEO and optimize content for ranking, engagement, and monetization. At times this may be a substantial portion of your role
  • Ideate, assign, and oversee production of content, as needed
  • Develop a basic understanding of the business plan and objectives of your coverage area, and how content fits into that plan
  • Help develop writers and offer feedback on their day-to-day performance and their performance reviews
  • Ensure content is high-quality and user-first and brings clarity to personal finance decisions
  • Demonstrate growing editorial judgment and topic expertise
  • Show growing creativity and produce different types of quality content within guidelines laid out by assigning editors
  • Go beyond surfacing teamwide problems to offer expertise, conceiving of solutions and helping to implement them
  • Look for opportunities to extend your influence beyond your immediate team, such as through special projects
  • Be a strong communicator who truly enjoys helping everyone improve
  • Recognize when elements of an article seem out of alignment with a good user experience and recommend solutions
  • Advocate for consumers by editing for clarity and accuracy

You are:

  • Is an expert editor and editing coach
  • Can handle the logistics and demands of large projects
  • Makes good prioritization decisions, spending an appropriate amount of time on each task
  • Excels at time management, prioritization, and handling multiple tasks at once
  • Is scrappy and fast-paced, with obsessive attention to detail
  • Is resourceful and self-directed. You can tackle a variety of assignments with minimal direction, and you always deliver polished work

Your experience:

  • 3 to 5+ years editing for consumer-facing publications
  • Experience in a startup environment is a plus
  • Knowledge of SEO best practices or interest in learning

What we offer:

  • Competitive compensation package
  • 401(k) with company match
  • 100% paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employee and their dependents
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Commuter, gym and cell phone stipend
  • $500 enrichment stipend toward learning and development for your role
  • Catered lunches daily, free dinner and kitchens stocked with snacks
  • Onsite coffee bar with baristas
  • Company happy hours, social events and outings
  • Generous, flexible vacation
  • Remote: co-working space subsidy
  • Remote: ergonomic desk, chair and/or keyboard subsidy

NerdWallet is committed to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

Apply for job

items.title: Success Factors (SF) Employee Central Consultant ---- REMOTE - 50% TRA
items.content:
Title : Success Factors (SF) Employee Central Consultant

Location : remote and must be open to up to 50% travel.

Duration: Full time/Permanent

Salary Range: Depend on Experience

Position Description:

Act as Senior SuccessFactors Employee Central Consultant and lead on assigned SuccessFactors implementation projects.

Duties and Responsibilities:

    1. Document client Employee Central requirements and map to other SuccessFactors modules as appropriate;
    2. Configure the SuccessFactors Employee Central solution and perform initial testing;
    1. Identify system functional gaps which will require system enhancements/customization;
    2. Test the SuccessFactors solution for accuracy and fulfillment of Employee Central requirements;
    3. Train users in master data management, new business processes, transactional activity, and report execution;
    4. Maintain accurate and up to date workbooks and other requirement gathering documents;
    1. Update SharePoint project site as directed by the Project Manager for accurate issue tracking and project reporting;
    2. Maintain accurate and up to date issue logs so that all gaps are documented and resolved;
  1. Support end users during hyper care immediately after go-live for the new SuccessFactors Employee Central solution; and
  2. Collaborate internally with other team members on continuous improvement.

Exhibit the following consulting competencies:

    1. Leadership: Display a positive and motivating approach; lives People Values and lets this be seen
    2. Relationship/Partner Management: Can professionally and/or personally respond to the individual needs of the customer and create a relationship of trust
    1. Communication: Positively influences through their own personality; is accepted at various levels as an appropriate partner in discussions; has a calm approach in stressful situations in which they take responsibility; has great personal integrity
  2. Result Orientation: Accepts responsibility for own tasks and projects, and manages these in terms of quality, productivity and resources

Position Requirements/Qualifications:

    1. Current SuccessFactors Employee Central Certification with up to date deltas;
    2. Bachelor s degree (or its equivalent) related to a Human Resources, Management, or IT discipline, or a related field of study;
    3. 5 years of SuccessFactors project implementation experience OR Master s degree and 3 years of experience
    4. 2 years integration experience with other SuccessFactors process areas
    5. 2 years leadership experience on SuccessFactors implementation projects
  2. Experience in multiple, full lifecycle SuccessFactors implementations

Preferred:

    1. Position Management experience
    2. Time and Attendance experience
    3. Benefits experience
    1. Knowledge of payroll integrations
    1. Integration knowledge of Boomi, CPI, or other middleware
    2. SuccessFactors Position Management or Time and Attendance Configuration experience
  2. Knowledge of SAP HCM
  3. SuccessFactors Integration Center experience
  4. Upgrade, Roll-out, and implementation projects

Specific questions to be answered by candidates for SF EC Consultant:

Is your certification current?

Are your quarterly deltas current?

How long have you been certified?

How many projects have you done? Were you the lead resource? Were they full projects?

What additional EC functionality have you configured such as Time and Attendance or Position Management?

Have you done an EC project with integrations? If so, what types? Payroll, benefits, SAP, other HRIS systems?

- provided by Dice

items.title: Healthcare Licensed Insurance Agent Work from Home
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Empathetic Service oriented. Attentive. It's what connects us and we'd like to connect with you too! We are looking for you to help us deliver exceptional customer experiences as a work from home Healthcare Licensed Insurance Agent with TTEC. Say hello to saving gas/transportation money and growing your career with one of FlexJobs' 2019 Top 100 companies for remote jobs. Goodbye, commute!

About TTEC:

We help global brands provide a great experience to their customers, build customer loyalty, and grow their business. We were founded on one guiding principle: customer experiences that are simple, inspired, and more human deliver lasting value for everyone. Your role brings that principle to life.

Life at TTEC:

As a global company, we're always on. When one of us is going to bed, a coworker half-way around the world has already had their coffee (or tea) and is ready to grab the baton and run with it. We work at a fast pace around here and we're not one for keeping the status quo. But just because we're busy, it doesn't mean we don't know how to have fun. We're passionate about throwing company events that bring us together to laugh and celebrate each other's achievements. We're also big on taking time out for professional development and giving back. So, if you're looking for a work-life full of purpose, passion and career potential, keep reading

As a TTEC Customer Experience Champion, You'll Enjoy:

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee Rewards and Employee Discounts
  • Continuous training and mentoring lots of learning for aspiring minds
  • Diverse, inclusive, and community-minded organization
  • A fun and encouraging remote work group

    • What You'll be Doing:

    Do you have a passion for helping others and giving them peace of mind? Whether it's getting answers for customers quickly, consulting on health-related products with compassion or resolving their issues with a smile, you'll be the difference between their customer experience being just average or an exceptional one.

    We'll train you to be a subject matter expert in your field, so you can be confident in providing the highest level of service possible. And we trust you already have the necessary ingredient that can't be taught-a caring and supportive nature that will shine through as you help customers through some of the more difficult times in their lives. You'll also have a chance to make great new friends and grow your career in a high-energy, family-friendly atmosphere. All from the comfort of your own home.

    On a typical day, you'll:

  • Consult with customers on health-related products and services to provide the best solutions for their health and financial well-being
  • Assist Medicare-eligible individuals in selecting the products and services that best meets their needs
  • Answer questions related to coverage and annual changes on healthcare plans, pharmacy networks and drug formularies
  • Aid customers with the enrollment process
  • Qualify customers to join community meetings and schedule in-home appointments

    • Why You? What You Bring:

    Empathetic. Service oriented. Attentive. It's what connects us Does this describe you as well?

  • A current health insurance license
  • You've done the sales thing at least six months.
  • We're looking for you to come with excellent communication skills.
  • You adapt to new and different situations, read the behaviors of others, have difficult conversations with ease, and defuse and resolve conflict. In other words, you have the gift of gab. Empathy is the key.
  • An ability to adapt and excel in a dynamic work environment
  • High school graduate or equivalent
  • Handy with MS Windows and other computer applications
  • The passion and drive to make a difference

    • The technology basics you'll need:

  • A dedicated telephone is required during employment (landline or cell phone) to ensure that you can be contacted throughout training and employment as needed
  • Your own computer that meet the technical specifications:
  • USB headset & USB drive is required to access our systems

items.title: Remote - Senior Regional Clinical Research Associate - ( Permanent )
items.content:
Job Description

A highly reputable and distinguished pharmaceutical corporation is currently looking for an experienced & qualified permanent Remote Senior Regional Clinical Research Associate to be home-based near Boston, MA.

Responsibilities:

  • Immediate onboarding, process and study training and site monitoring activities
  • Coordinate Clinical Trials including activities such as:
  • Visiting trial sites regularly
  • Acting as liaison between project managers and research-site personnel
  • Maintaining the quality of the work and relationships
  • Monitoring the conduct of clinical trials and compliance with established timelines
  • Ensuring harmonization of in-house monitoring practices
  • Ensure Quality Assurance of projects including:
  • Adhering to protocol regulatory requirements
  • Good clinical practice regulations, and standard operating procedures
  • Assessing the trial site and applicable personnel on an ongoing basis
  • Ensuring compliance with the patient-consent process
  • Verifying the receipt, handling, accounting, storage conditions, and availability of clinical products under investigation
  • Verifying compliance and quality of collected data
  • Ensuring compliance with the procedures to apply in the event of serious adverse events
  • Drafting an appropriate intervention plan for the avoidance of redundant errors and deviations
  • Verifying investigator records and checks for consistency with the contents of sponsor files
  • Assesses site qualification potential: reviews study requirements; conducts pre-study visits and drafts pre-study evaluation reports.
  • Participates in the implementation of clinical studies: communicates with investigators and their staff; ensures compliance with terms and conditions; properly trains site personnel and writes initiation visit reports.
  • Supervises the conduct of clinical studies: acts as liaison between site personnel and the sponsor; performs monitoring in the field; ensures compliance with protocols, regulatory requirements, and good clinical practices; writes follow-up visit reports.
  • Ensures the quality of the project: verifies materials and data integrity; assists site personnel with internal audits or regulatory inspections; and perform ongoing follow-up with the in-house project team.
  • Closes clinical studies: verifies the integrity of investigator files; ensures availability of clinical and non-clinical materials; jointly reviews with investigators the obligations inherent at the end of the study and writes closure visit reports.

Requirements:

  • Must have at least a bachelor s degree, preferably in a life science.
  • 5 years experience as an on-site CRA/full-site manager that has completed all types of monitoring visits.
  • Experience with multiple eCRF platforms, CTMS, eTMF a plus
  • Prefer candidates with previous experience in complex therapeutic indications.
  • Must be available to travel 75-80%.
  • Must have strong written and verbal communication skills; learn quickly; handle multiple studies and aggressive timelines.
  • Excellent team player

Company Description

Beacon Hill Pharma, Beacon Hill Staffing Group's Pharma specialty division, is a national staffing organization that provides contract, direct (permanent), FSP/outsourcing and consulting to pharmaceutical, medical device, biotech and contract research organizations.

Beacon Hill Pharma places contractors in all 50 states by seamlessly coordinating recruiting resources in local and regional markets with Beacon Hill Pharmas National Recruiting & Delivery, a dedicated national recruiting team that focuses exclusively on national accounts, supporting regional recruiting operations and delivering contractors to all markets in the U.S.

Whether start-ups or the Fortune 500, the public or private sector, Beacon Hill Pharma matches world class talent with exceptional opportunities.

Associated topics: clinical, clinical development, clinical informatics, clinical trial, coordinator, lab, laboratory, research, research coordinator

items.title: Baby Equipment Vendor
items.content:
Job Description

As a Baby Equipment Vendor, you will be able to make some extra cash from the comfort of your own home! THIS IS YOUR OPPORTUNITY! Maybe you're a stay at home parent or a retired veteran and you want to be your own boss and make some extra cash!

You will be able to rent your own quality baby equipment to traveling families to start your own service.

Having children comes with a lot of packing for vacation; cribs, strollers, car seats, toys, etc. You will make a families trip easy and breezy with providing them with the convenience of renting the baby equipment they need.

Anyone with extra quality baby equipment is qualified! This means items like cribs, strollers, car seats, toys, high chairs, and more! We are looking for hard working individuals who are willing to dedicate time to get to work. Baby Equipment Vendors will be able to operate by delivering and picking up baby items to store out of their homes. Babies Getaway is an ideal partner to help you get your business on the way and you will be your own boss.

Please be aware, you will need an SUV to deliver and pick up items. Items will also be stored in your SMOKE FREE home or a safe location such as a warehouse or storage unit.

items.title: Transplant/Bariatric Nurse I/II - Remote - PS23457
items.content:
Transplant/Bariatric Nurse I/II - Remote - PS23457
**Location:** **United States**
**New**
**Requisition #:** PS23457
**Post Date:** 2 days ago
_Your Talent. Our Vision._ **At Anthem, Inc.,** its a powerful combination, and the foundation upon which were creating greater care for our members, greater value for our customers, and greater health for our communities. Join us and together we will **drive the future of health care** .
This is an exceptional opportunity to do innovative work that means more to you and those we serve at one of America's leading health benefits companies and a Fortune Top 50 Company.
**Transplant Nurse I/II**
Location: Remote/Work At Home
**Hours:** **Mon - Fri** **8:30am - 5:00pm (EST)**
Please note: This position may be filled at either the Transplant Nurse I or
Transplant Nurse II level. Manager will determine level based upon the selected applicant's skillset relative to the qualifications listed for this position.
The **Transplant Nurse** provides utilization/medical management and case management services for members receiving transplant services. The Level I Transplant Nurse focuses on utilization management responsibilities while preparing to advance to Level II which focuses on case management responsibilities.
**_Medical management responsibilities_** include:
+ Collaborate with healthcare providers and members to promote quality member outcomes, to optimize member benefits, and to promote effective use of resources for medical transplant issues.
+ Conduct precertifications/predeterminations.
+ Ensure medically appropriate, high quality, cost effective care through assessing the medical necessity of inpatient admissions, outpatient services, focused surgical and diagnostic procedures, out of network services, and appropriateness of treatment setting by utilizing the applicable medical policy and industry standards, accurately interpreting benefits and managed care products, and steering members to appropriate providers, programs or community resources.
+ Consults with clinical reviewers to ensure member access to medically necessary, quality healthcare in a cost effective setting according to contract.
**_Case management responsibilities_** will, within the scope of licensure, include:
+ Assess, develop, implement coordinate, monitor, and evaluate care plans designed to optimize member health care across the care continuum and ensuring member access to services appropriate to their specific health needs.
+ Conducts assessments to identify individual needs and prepares specific care management plans to address objectives and goals as identified during assessments.
+ Coordinates internal and external resources to meet identified needs.
+ Monitors and evaluates effectiveness of the care management plan and modifies as necessary.
+ Interfaces with Medical Directors and Physician Advisors on the development of care management treatment plans.
+ Both roles facilitate accreditation by knowing, understanding, correctly interpreting, and accurately applying accrediting and regulatory requirements and standards.
**Transplant Nurse I/II**
+ Requires an AS in nursing, BSN preferred; 2 years of clinical experience preferably 3+ years of pertinent clinical experience in transplant or oncology, and/or case management or utilization management experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
+ Current unrestricted RN license in applicable state(s).
+ Certification in Case Management preferred.
+ Strong written, oral and interpersonal communication skills.
+ Ability to comprehend medical policy and criteria to clearly articulate health information.
+ Broad clinical knowledge base of disease processes.
+ Ability to interpret and analyze medical information.
+ Knowledge of case management assessment techniques and health care service providers, community organizations and state agencies.
+ An understanding of appropriate member contracts and awareness of contract benefits.
+ Excellent people skills sufficient to establish relationships with members, families, providers, etc.
+ Strong customer service orientation.
+ Ability to multi-task.
+ Requires organizational, problem solving and decision-making skills.
+ Strong knowledge of PCs and related applications such as Excel, Word, Access, etc.
As business needs may require, **_this position may require additional state licenses_** either now or in the future. Inability or unwillingness to obtain these required licenses may result in either re-assignment (if available) or termination. Obtaining required licenses is a requirement for continued employment.
**_Anthem, Inc. is ranked as one of Americas Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine and is a 2018 DiversityInc magazine Top 50 Company for Diversity. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.antheminc.com. An Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran._**
Associated topics: hemodialysis, lead, lpn, lvn lpn, med surg, nurse i, nurse lpn, nurses, practical, practical nurse

items.title: REMOTE CODING AUDITOR (Inpatient) - Acuity Search Solutions, Inc. (New York)
items.content:
(Only QUALIFIED Healthcare Professionals accepted) Coding AUDITOR Needed!




There is an immediate need for an Inpatient Coding Auditor

Full-Time, Permanent Position

This is a WORK FROM HOME position!

Required: 3-5 years of Coding Auditing experience and (CCS or RHIT or RHIA)

Experience Auditing for Multi-System Hospitals




The salary range on this one is phenomenal! Don't wait, call David at 513-###-#### or send resumes to: ...@acuitymri.com

Job description:
Auditing records/accounts to insure accuracy of the code assignments (ICD-9-CM and/or CPT-4), discharge disposition assignments, MS-DRG assignments, POA assignments, APC assignments and/or modifier assignments.
Identify areas where further education is needed related to potential risk areas for coding quality and communicate this with the education department for formulation of action plans or in-services.
Reporting on the accuracy of the coded and abstracted data elements.
Updating client compliance programs such as SharePoint
Conducting trend analyses to indentify patterns and variation in coding practices and/or severity of illness - case mix.
Conducting internal investigation of changes in coding practices or reports of other potential problems relating to coding
Reports noncompliance issues detected through auditing and monitoring.
Reviews claim denials and rejections pertaining to coding and medical necessity issues. Assists in the development of action plans as well as educational programs to prevent similar denials and rejections from recurring.
Maintains compliance data for PHS an each coding professional.
Validate coding professionals skill sets to review, analyze, abstract, and code records following all official guidelines.
Utilize internal and qualified external resources to clarify coding policies, guidelines and gray areas while adhering to individual client and contracted facility coding policies. Communicate information to remote and contracted coding support teams.
Ability to assess/evaluate coding skills and educational needs.
Ability to fulfill all major activities and performance expectations as detailed in the Coder job description.
Completes other projects and tasks as assigned by Manager



Minimum of three (3) years of various inpatient coding experience MS-DRG expertise required.
One of the following credentials is required: RHIA, RHIT, CCS, or CCS-P.
Ability to successfully perform coding quality evaluations to validate correct coding, following Official Coding Guidelines, in addition to the Pyramid Healthcare Coding Quality Policy & Procedure.
Ability to learn and utilize various hospital systems along with an encoder product.
Familiarity with current healthcare based technology and Electronic Health Record. Efficiently complete, comprehend and use PHS coding compliance tools.
Knowledge of various hospital information systems, encoders and other technology to facilitate a virtual work environment while maintaining maximum communication and adhering to HIPAA security standards
Must have access to high-speed internet and be in compliance with PHS Remote Employee specifications.
Must have personal computer skills including MS Outlook, MS Word, MS Excel, MS Power Point, along with encoding software experience.
Must have the technical skills required to learn and navigate a variety of software systems, trouble-shoot computer problems, install periodic updates to software programs and work efficiently in a virtual environment.
Must have strong written and verbal communication skills

Must possess advanced problem-solving skills.

items.content:
Job Description

Earn up to $20/hour base, or $50/hour effective compensation after commissions/bonuses!


We seek to pay above average wages for clever, highly resourceful, brave and influential appointment setters with B2B or advertising sales experience. You will work from an easy to learn CRM which will provide prospects' information and are only responsible for making the calls and setting the appointments. Our outside sales representatives will close the deals and when they do you will earn a very generous bonus which is what could boost your hourly effective rate up to $50 per hour.


Our company, Terraboost Media, is growing rapidly because we deliver exceptional value and something fresh to local community advertisers to get the word out about their company or practice. We provide \"hand sanitizing wipe kiosks\" at the front doors of major national grocery store chains, drug store chains, malls and airports. These kiosks feature a giant photographic quality ad space available to local businesses on an exclusive basis. Kindly go to www.sponsorwellness.com to learn more about the product. Basically you will be setting appointments for a highly coveted health & wellness sponsorship on an exclusive basis. Your prospects will be excited to hear from you!!!


This is a part-time opportunity, working a maximum of 29 hours per week. We are looking for appointment setters to work Monday through Thursday from 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., Eastern Standard Time.



Requirements

The ideal candidate:
Has a desire and hunger to earn money -a hunter mentality.
Is a self-starter, able to work independently.
Has 2+ years of appointment setting, lead generation or outbound calling experience.
Has a great personality with the ability to engage others quickly.
Exhibits dynamic verbal communication skills and the ability to \"sell the appointment\".
Has basic computer skills (Windows, email, Google, able to easily navigate internet).
Has great prospecting/lead generation skills and a proven track record of success.
Has a Windows computer and access to internet.

items.title: Simple Health: Compliance Operations Specialist (Part time, Remote)
items.content:
Compliance Operations Specialist (Part time, Remote)

Healthcare is anything but simple. At Simple Health, we’re on a challenging, unique mission to bring simplicity and convenience back to routine eye-care. We’re also on a mission to find the best queso in the country...but the eye-care stuff comes first. If you’re as passionate about transforming the healthcare system (no easy feat) and finding quality queso (slightly easier feat) as we are, then we want you on our team!

The Job
As part of the compliance operations team, you'll be there for our patients right off the bat. You’ll make sure that our patients get the contact lenses that they need every time, all the time. In other words, you’ll be our patient’s best friend!

This position is part time, requires a minimum of 12 hours of work a week and is paid hourly. The position will be fully remote.

What you’ll do
  • Review prescriptions as they come in, making sure that our patients are ordering the correct lenses
  • Contact doctor’s offices to verify patients’ prescriptions
  • Review our prescription renewal tests for quality assurance
  • Provide feedback to patients taking our prescription renewal tests
  • Communicate within the team to make sure that our patients are having the best experience possible

Who you are
We’re looking for self-starters and fast learners; folks who can adapt and are always up for new challenges. While you don’t need any particular job experience, you’ve definitely gotta have the following:

  • High attention to detail
  • The ability to communicate effectively and empathetically
  • An analytical and logical approach to solving problems
  • Flexibility and ability to adapt
  • Satisfaction in a job well done!

Who we are
We’re still a small company, but we’ve got big plans. You’ll contribute to our mission to make healthcare more accessible and affordable. Healthcare tech is exciting and dynamic, and you’ll be at the forefront of this revolution. Plus, nothing’s better than working from home in your pajamas.

Travel Requirements:

It is not designed to contain a comprehensive detailed inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employees assigned to the job. items.title: Profile Coach
items.content:
Profile Coach at Trilogy Education Services

Remote | International

Location: Remote

About Trilogy

Powered by big dreams and small egos, Trilogy is reimagining how skills-based learning can change the face of education. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top universities to create boot camps that prepare highly-motivated students for high-growth careers. And although we’ve successfully graduated hundreds of students, this is truly Day 1 for us.

Driven by a one-team mentality, we’re looking for those with the hunger, talent, and passion to ride this wave with us.

Trilogy is the first of its kind to bring the successful web development boot camp model in house to academic institutions while supporting the entire student academic journey. Our platform combines coding curriculum, student recruitment, and career placement services to elevate graduates for increased job market success. We are in high-growth mode and rapidly expanding our family of partners.

We are seeking…

A well written and highly communicative Profile Coach to aid in reviewing, providing feedback, and helping our students build the professional documents needed to get hired. We have expanded our international partnerships to include universities around the world and the successful candidate will play a key role in the success of these new programs. Our students currently work with some of the best companies in the world, from startup to enterprise level: Deloitte, IBM, CardCash, and others. You will be responsible for providing feedback on, and guiding students through, revisions on their technical resumes, cover letters, social media footprint, and portfolio.

High-level view of who you are:

  • You are comfortable working with written business documents in English.
  • You have a professional and critical eye to detail that will help enhance and/or provide needed assistance with students’ career materials and your professional writing and communication skills have been used repeatedly in either resume writing, career preparation, or human resource functions.
  • You are passionate about making the world a better place through skills-based education.
  • You are excited to engage with students and help them create a portfolio of documents that will drive them to obtain a new job.

In this job you will:

  • Provide timely feedback to students in various programs to polish their online profiles including resumes, cover letters, social media footprint, and technical portfolio.
  • Provide expertise that will help optimize templates for resumes, online portfolios, and other tools used for people to get hired.
  • Take a consultative approach, ensuring you are building a student’s confidence while guiding them on their professional documents.
  • Communicate and coordinate with students over multiple locations as well as with our internal Career Services team.
  • Collaborate with various departments to create or streamline team tools and processes.
  • Participate in training new team members as assigned by the training coordinator.
  • Run or assist with online student workshops.
  • Maintain accurate records of activity through our software.
  • Manage your time appropriately while meeting deadlines.
  • Be responsible for individual goals and metrics.
  • Attend required team and company meetings.
  • Participate in additional projects and other duties as assigned.

What makes you a great fit for this role (Requirements):

  • Fluency in speaking and writing English is required. Fluency in Spanish and experience with written career search materials in Spanish would be a bonus but is not a requirement.
  • Certified Professional Resume Writers (CPRW) and Nationally Certified Resume Writers (NCRW) certification is helpful, but not required. Those with career coaching, human resources, or technical recruiting experience will also be considered.
  • Excellent communication skills: you will need to engage through text, so strong writing skills are essential as well as impeccable attention to detail.
  • The ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines with minimal supervision. Self-direction required.
  • Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word/Google Docs.
  • Possesses strong collaboration skills and the ability to be a team player.
  • Ability to communicate effectively across departments and diverse sets of colleague and adjust rapidly to changing environment/workflow.
  • Comfort level with ambiguity and willingness to take risks.
  • Experience with Salesforce or other CRM is preferred.
  • Solid tech and industry knowledge very helpful, but not required.
  • Technical sourcing experience helpful, but not required.
Apply for job

items.content: GeBBS Healthcare Solutions, an industry leader in Health Information Management (HIM) and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) solutions, is seeking highly-motivated individuals with a passion for excellence & collaboration, for careers in the healthcare industry.SummaryGeBBS Healthcare Solutions is seeking Full-Time or Part Time Risk Adjustment Coders who can commit to working at least 20 hours/week. The primary responsibility of the Risk Adjustment Coder is to confirm any risk adjustment error findings. Codes will be assigned based on medical record documentation, originating from the provider of service, and in alignment with date of service selected in sample. This is a remote role where you will work out of your home office.Roles And ResponsibilitiesConfirm all risk adjusted diagnosis codes from acceptable provider documentation and in accordance with industry standards for coding and reporting.Adherence to current industry standard, as defined in the ICD-9, or ICD-10 guidelines for coding and reporting.Confirm accurate entry of risk adjusted codes into proprietary software or database as defined by project and client scope.Assist in drafting an audit summary report according to GeBBS standards and in accordance with client needs.Must be able to meet productivity standards as assigned by GeBBS and the specific client deadlines.Must be able to maintain 95% accuracy and completeness in ongoing quality assurance reviews as required by GeBBS internal QA policy.Must agree to all corporate security and privacy policies in accordance with the GeBBS Compliance policy.Additional duties as necessary to meet the obligations to our clients.Minimum Qualifications And ExperienceQualifications: AAPC or AHIMA coding certification required(apprenticeship credentials are not accepted at this time)A minimum of 2 years' experience required abstracting risk adjusted codes from acceptable medical record documentation.Must have experience with data entry of codes into a database and/or software tool.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and EMR (Electronic Medical Record) systems.Extensive knowledge of medical terminology and ability to research coding related questions.Requires advanced technical knowledge in specific surgical and medical specialties as assigned.Why Work at GeBBSGeBBS delivers a people-oriented, equal opportunity culture that supports a friendly work environment, innovative ideas, and a benefits-rich employee package.Paid Time Off (PTO)Medical, Dental, Vision and Life InsuranceAD&D401K EligibilityWe provide strategic solutions to an expanding customer base of healthcare providers, and medical billing companies. With a current staff of over 6,000 professionals, GeBBS is a 10-time Inc. 5000 honoree as one of the nation's fastest growing companies."People are our greatest asset" is much more than just an expression to GeBBS. We make every effort to foster an environment where our teams can find an ideal balance between work and fun. Employees at GeBBS believe in being client-centric, open and ethical, innovative, and outcome-driven.Equal Opportunity EmployerGeBBS is an equal opportunity employer and believes in creating a supportive and diverse workplace. We want to have the best available people in every job. Therefore, the Company does not discriminate, and does not permit its employees to discriminate.Learn more about GeBBS Healthcare SolutionsHealthcare Solutions is a leading provider of revenue cycle management (RCM) and health information management (HIM) solutions. Our in-depth healthcare industry expertise enables us to provide innovative end-to-end solutions to successfully resolve our clients billing challenges, while enhancing their overall business operations. GeBBS delivers an infrastructure of highly skilled professionals and proprietary workflow technology platforms. This makes us an ideal partner for our clients.We provide strategic outsourcing solutions to medical billing companies and healthcare providers. By leveraging our people, processes and technology, we enable clients to reduce operating and capital costs, improve patient satisfaction, recover revenue, and increase productivity. With a staff of over 6,000 professionals, GeBBS is an ten-time Inc. 5000 honoree as one of the nation's fastest growing companies.

items.title: Healthcare Licensed Insurance Agent - Work from Home (Kansas City)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Empathetic Service oriented. Attentive. It's what connects us and we'd like to connect with you too! We are looking for you to help us deliver exceptional customer experiences as a work from home Healthcare Licensed Insurance Agent with TTEC. Say hello to saving gas/transportation money and growing your career with one of FlexJobs' 2019 Top 100 companies for remote jobs. Goodbye, commute!

About TTEC:

We help global brands provide a great experience to their customers, build customer loyalty, and grow their business. We were founded on one guiding principle: customer experiences that are simple, inspired, and more human deliver lasting value for everyone. Your role brings that principle to life.

Life at TTEC:

As a global company, we're always on. When one of us is going to bed, a coworker half-way around the world has already had their coffee (or tea) and is ready to grab the baton and run with it. We work at a fast pace around here and we're not one for keeping the status quo. But just because we're busy, it doesn't mean we don't know how to have fun. We're passionate about throwing company events that bring us together to laugh and celebrate each other's achievements. We're also big on taking time out for professional development and giving back. So, if you're looking for a work-life full of purpose, passion and career potential, keep reading

As a TTEC Customer Experience Champion, You'll Enjoy:

  • Career advancement opportunities
  • Employee Rewards and Employee Discounts
  • Continuous training and mentoring - lots of learning for aspiring minds
  • Diverse, inclusive, and community-minded organization
  • A fun and encouraging remote work group

    • What You'll be Doing:

    Do you have a passion for helping others and giving them peace of mind? Whether it's getting answers for customers quickly, consulting on health-related products with compassion or resolving their issues with a smile, you'll be the difference between their customer experience being just average or an exceptional one.

    We'll train you to be a subject matter expert in your field, so you can be confident in providing the highest level of service possible. And we trust you already have the necessary ingredient that can't be taught-a caring and supportive nature that will shine through as you help customers through some of the more difficult times in their lives. You'll also have a chance to make great new friends and grow your career in a high-energy, family-friendly atmosphere. All from the comfort of your own home.

    On a typical day, you'll:

  • Consult with customers on health-related products and services to provide the best solutions for their health and financial well-being
  • Assist Medicare-eligible individuals in selecting the products and services that best meets their needs
  • Answer questions related to coverage and annual changes on healthcare plans, pharmacy networks and drug formularies
  • Aid customers with the enrollment process
  • Qualify customers to join community meetings and schedule in-home appointments

    • Why You? What You Bring:

    Empathetic. Service oriented. Attentive. It's what connects us Does this describe you as well?

  • A current health insurance license
  • You've done the sales thing at least six months.
  • We're looking for you to come with excellent communication skills.
  • You adapt to new and different situations, read the behaviors of others, have difficult conversations with ease, and defuse and resolve conflict. In other words, you have the gift of gab. Empathy is the key.
  • An ability to adapt and excel in a dynamic work environment
  • High school graduate or equivalent
  • Handy with MS Windows and other computer applications
  • The passion and drive to make a difference

    • The technology basics you'll need:

  • A dedicated telephone is required during employment (landline or cell phone) to ensure that you can be contacted throughout training and employment as needed
  • Your own computer that meet the technical specifications:
  • USB headset & USB drive is required to access our systems

items.title: Dog Sitter - Flexible Hours, Work From Home, Play With Dogs
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Want to make money watching dogs at home or around your neighborhood? We're looking for animal lovers like you to join Rover as independent pet sitters.

Set your own schedule: Full time, part time work as much or as little as you want, it's up to you!

Earn money on your terms: Make money, manage your business from anywhere, and work from home. Successful sitters earn up to $1000/month or more!

Be your own boss: Make your own rules and enjoy the flexibility of working for yourself.

Choose your services: Opt for any combination of dog boarding, dog walking, doggy day care, drop-in visits, or house sitting.

Get 24/7 support: We've got your back with our sitter support team, available 24/7.

How it works:

Create a profile on Rover.com that shows how awesome you are as a pet sitter. Once it's approved, pet parents will be able to find you on our site and contact you via your Rover profile for their pet sitting needs.

Requirements:

Be at least 18 years old
Pass a general background check
Verifiable phone number (landline or mobile)
A genuine love for animals (and experience caring for them too)

About Rover

Founded on the belief that everyone should have the opportunity to experience the unconditional love of a dog, Rover improves and simplifies life for dog people and the pets they love.

Serving pet parents across the U.S., Canada, and parts of Europe, Rover connects dog owners with trusted pet care whenever they need it. Millions of services have been booked on Rover, including pet sitting, dog walking, in-home dog boarding, and doggy day care.

Additional details:

This is a great opportunity for current freelance dog care providers, and others in the pet care industry such as vet techs and vet assistants. Teachers, retirees, or anyone with a flexible work schedule are also a great fit. Individuals who currently work from home, students, interns, or contract workers looking to earn additional money on the side can also make great pet care providers. Rover dog sitters come from a variety of backgrounds and industries, including customer service, sales, retail, and restaurants (baristas, bartenders, servers, food runners, waiters/waitresses, restaurant hosts, hostesses, and busboys). Being a Rover sitter requires care and attention, so previous experience as a babysitter or caregiver can be invaluable. Because of their flexible schedule, Rover sitters have also worked at Care.com, Grubhub, Seamless, DoorDash, Eat24, Caviar, Munchery, Saucey, Google Express, AmazonFresh, Instacart, Sprig, Luxe, Zirx, Lyft, Uber, Wag, Shipt, and Postmates. Keep in mind that If you want to offer doggy day care or dog walking, weekday availability is key. If you're looking for flexible work, gig work, part-time work, seasonal work, a summer job or just want earn additional money on the side, Rover could be a great fit for you. Most importantly, successful sitters are dog lovers first!PandoLogic. Category: Agriculture & Pets, Keywords: Pet Sitter

items.title: [Remote] Part-Time Online English Instructor
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Remote / Online English Teacher

Looking for a flexible, remote teaching opportunity? We are seeking passionate educators to teach English online to over 600,000 students in China - with the ability to work from home and earn up to $22/hr!

Why Teach with VIPKid?
  • Flexibility with no commute and no minimum hours - you can teach part-time

  • Curriculum provided so that you can focus on just teaching

  • Exclusive voluntary workshops to develop and fine-tune your teaching skills both inside and outside of the VIPKid platform

  • Earn up to $22/hr plus the opportunity to earn more through referral bonuses, teaching incentives and other promotions

  • Enthusiastic and supportive community of 70,000+ teachers

  • Optional local events and quarterly conferences


    • Requirements
  • A Bachelor's degree or higher

  • Eligibility to work in the U.S. or Canada

  • At least 1 year of teaching experience (including homeschooling, tutoring, coaching, mentoring, and other experiences)

  • Teaching credential preferred but not required (for those without a teaching credential, candidates can earn our proprietary VIPKid-TESOL Certification of Completion)


    • WHO WE ARE
    VIPKid is Forbes #1 rated company for Remote Jobs and ranked in the Top 100 Best Places to Work 2019 by Glassdoor. We connect children in China with the world's best teachers for real-time one-to-one online English immersion learning. Simply said, we allow teachers to change kids' lives while being able to work from home.

    A global education technology company, our mission is to inspire and empower every child for the future. Founded in 2013, we have become one of the world's market-leading education technology companies, with offices in both China and the U.S., and 10 more international offices over the next three years.

items.title: Remote Lead Medical Coder
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
A full time Remote Lead Medical Coder is needed with a fantastic healthcare organization in Colorado! This award-winning organization is looking to bring on a new Lead Coder due to their expansions and is looking for someone with strong inpatient coding experience.

The full time Lead Medical Coder Remote will work a great Monday Friday schedule with no weekends and can choose their work hours in a consistent 8-hour work day time block. The Medical Coder Inpatient Lead will report to the HIM Supervisor and will assist and mentor entry level coders in the department.

The Remote Medical Coder Lead will join an outstanding medical organization that is consistently recognized by many organizations for their quality care in nursing and various specialties. This organization is extremely financially stable and continues to grow and expand their services throughout the community.

The Lead Coder Remote will work in coding with the pediatric patient population with an average of 4-5 days of inpatient hospital stays. Prior pediatric coding experience is preferred but not required for consideration. The Lead Coder will have the flexibility to work remote from other states if desired, or if local the option to work from home or come into the office.

The Remote Lead Medical Coder will be offered a generous salary and full suite of benefits. Apply today for a fantastic opportunity for a Remote Coder Lead or in beautiful Central Colorado!

items.title: Life and Health Underwriter II
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Life and Health Underwriter II at USAA

Remote

Location: San Antonio, Texas

Secondary Locations: REMOTE, ZZ

Job ID: R0035050

Purpose of Job

“We are currently seeking a talented Life and Health Underwriting Associate II for our San Antonio, TX facility OR Remote.
The Life and Health Underwriting Associate II underwrites individual life and health insurance applicants according to established guidelines for the issuance of policies and within the approved binding authority. In addition, this role determines whether to accept, modify, or decline a risk through evaluation of an individual’s medical history or physical condition, occupational hazards, financial background, insurable interest and other information pertinent to the decision.”

Job Requirements

  • Examines application forms, medical reports and investigative reports to determine degree of risk and adequacy of underwriting information.
  • Applies developing knowledge of the life insurance industry and life and health products and services.
  • Underwrites routine cases using requirements and medical information that cannot be automatically reviewed.
  • Discusses rate class recommendations and status of files, requests additional underwriting information for proper risk assessment, and explains underwriting decisions with internal and external customers.
  • Consults with reinsurers to place coverage or discuss reinsurance decisions.
  • Resolves routine to moderately complex member complaints and issues.

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree OR 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a Degree
  • 2 or more years financial services or health related industry experience
  • 2 or more years underwriting experience
  • Academy of Life Underwriting courses 101 and 201 complete

Preferred Experience:

  • Life Insurance Underwriting experience with a minimum binding authority of $1,000,000
  • Obtained or working towards obtaining FLMI and/or FALU certification
  • Ability to travel to San Antonio for the first 4 weeks in the position for training
  • Advanced knowledge of medical terminology
  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits package in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.

Job Type:
C: 4.998

Apply for job

items.title: Simple Health: Compliance Operations Specialist (Remote)
items.content:
Compliance Operations Specialist (Remote)

Healthcare is anything but simple. At Simple Health, we’re on a challenging, unique mission to bring simplicity and convenience back to routine eye-care. We’re also on a mission to find the best queso in the country...but the eye-care stuff comes first. If you’re as passionate about transforming the healthcare system (no easy feat) and finding quality queso (slightly easier feat) as we are, then we want you on our team!

The Job
As part of the compliance operations team, you'll be there for our patients right off the bat. You’ll make sure that our patients get the contact lenses that they need every time, all the time. In other words, you’ll be our patient’s best friend!

This position is part time and requires a minimum of 12 hours of work a week and is paid hourly. The position will be fully remote.

What you’ll do
  • Review prescriptions as they come in, making sure that our patients are ordering the correct lenses
  • Contact doctor’s offices to verify patients’ prescriptions
  • Review our prescription renewal tests for quality assurance
  • Provide feedback to patients taking our prescription renewal tests
  • Communicate within the team to make sure that our patients are having the best experience possible

Who you are
We’re looking for self-starters and fast learners; folks who can adapt and are always up for new challenges. While you don’t need any particular job experience, you’ve definitely gotta have the following:

  • High attention to detail
  • The ability to communicate effectively and empathetically
  • An analytical and logical approach to solving problems
  • Flexibility and ability to adapt
  • Satisfaction in a job well done!

Who we are
We’re still a small company, but we’ve got big plans. You’ll contribute to our mission to make healthcare more accessible and affordable. Healthcare tech is exciting and dynamic, and you’ll be at the forefront of this revolution. Plus, nothing’s better than working from home in your pajamas.

If you are a Adaptive Planning Consultant (Full time, 100% Remote) with experience, please read on!

We are offering a unique opportunity for an Associate with a background in accounting and/or financial planning and analysis (FP&A) to join our growing financial advising company. This position is a client-facing role focusing on accounting and ERP solutions, financial consolidation, budgeting, planning, forecasting and reporting.

This Consultant will execute multiple client projects ranging from consulting services and client support, to full implementations. The successful candidate must demonstrate willingness to go the extra mile for the team's success. They will be a problem solver, creative thinker, fast learner, be detail-oriented, and interested in learning their clients' business.

BS/BA in Accounting or Finance

2+ years of experience with budgeting, forecasting and financial reporting/consolidation
Strong conceptual, analytic and problem solving skills
Strong project and time management skills

items.content: GeBBS Healthcare Solutions, an industry leader in Health Information Management (HIM) and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) solutions, is seeking highly-motivated individuals with a passion for excellence & collaboration, for careers in the healthcare industry.SummaryGeBBS Healthcare Solutions is seeking Full-Time or Part Time Risk Adjustment Coders who can commit to working at least 20 hours/week. The primary responsibility of the Risk Adjustment Coder is to confirm any risk adjustment error findings. Codes will be assigned based on medical record documentation, originating from the provider of service, and in alignment with date of service selected in sample. This is a remote role where you will work out of your home office.Roles And ResponsibilitiesConfirm all risk adjusted diagnosis codes from acceptable provider documentation and in accordance with industry standards for coding and reporting.Adherence to current industry standard, as defined in the ICD-9, or ICD-10 guidelines for coding and reporting.Confirm accurate entry of risk adjusted codes into proprietary software or database as defined by project and client scope.Assist in drafting an audit summary report according to GeBBS standards and in accordance with client needs.Must be able to meet productivity standards as assigned by GeBBS and the specific client deadlines.Must be able to maintain 95% accuracy and completeness in ongoing quality assurance reviews as required by GeBBS internal QA policy.Must agree to all corporate security and privacy policies in accordance with the GeBBS Compliance policy.Additional duties as necessary to meet the obligations to our clients.Minimum Qualifications And ExperienceQualifications: AAPC or AHIMA coding certification required(apprenticeship credentials are not accepted at this time)A minimum of 2 years' experience required abstracting risk adjusted codes from acceptable medical record documentation.Must have experience with data entry of codes into a database and/or software tool.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and EMR (Electronic Medical Record) systems.Extensive knowledge of medical terminology and ability to research coding related questions.Requires advanced technical knowledge in specific surgical and medical specialties as assigned.Why Work at GeBBSGeBBS delivers a people-oriented, equal opportunity culture that supports a friendly work environment, innovative ideas, and a benefits-rich employee package.Paid Time Off (PTO)Medical, Dental, Vision and Life InsuranceAD&D401K EligibilityWe provide strategic solutions to an expanding customer base of healthcare providers, and medical billing companies. items.content:
Registered Dietician at Healthfirst

Remote

Full Time

Telecommute

The Registered Dietitian, Care Manager is responsible for assessing the nutritional needs of members and helping them achieve an optimal level of independent functioning. The Registered Dietitian, Care Manager collaborates with a care management team (which may include RN’s, Social Workers, and Coordinators) to evaluate members and provides education and consultation to members, family/caregivers, and other people responsible for the member’s shared care.

  • Consults with and educates members, families/caregivers, and other relevant care team members on nutritional needs and pertinent care plans.
  • Ensures compliance with applicable NYS regulations.
  • Documents member and provider interactions in compliance with our internal policies.
  • Collaborates with the care management team as needed to safeguard the appropriateness and effectiveness of services recommended/utilized.
  • Additional duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Registered Dietitian (RD/RDN) in good standing.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Basic skills using security tools such as encryption, efaxing, and electronic archiving.
  • Language preferences – Spanish, Russian, French, Creole, Mandarin, Cantonese.
  • Relevant work experience.
  • Telephonic assessment skills.
  • Certified Dietitian-Nutritionist (CDN)
  • Proficiency in navigating internet browsers, computer hardware, and multi-tasking with multiple electronic documentation systems.
  • Demonstrated professional writing and electronic documentation skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage large caseloads and effectively work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong computer skills, including Microsoft Word and Excel, and demonstrated ability to learn new programs.

items.title: Compliance Counsel
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Compliance Counsel at Cardinal Financial

Remote

Location: Remote

Who We Are:

Cardinal Financial is a nationwide direct mortgage lender whose mission is to prove that homeownership is possible for everyone. By bringing an open-minded approach to an often closed-minded industry, we’re able to embrace every unique financial situation differently in order to craft the best possible loans for our borrowers. We pride ourselves on providing excellent service backed by our groundbreaking technology, and these two components of our process come together to complete a simple, personalized mortgage experience. But it all starts with our people.

We believe that no matter where you fit in our organization—Sales, Human Resources, Information Technology, or even re-stocking the break rooms with endless coffee supplies—everyone can influence the experience that we provide to our customers and our partners. We tell our customers and our partners that anything can be reimagined. So why not your career? Looking to join a company that values its people, innovates and expands on its proprietary technology, and is growing at a ridiculous rate?! Apply below!

What You Will Do:

  • Oversight of Cardinal’s mortgage documents within its proprietary loan origination system. This will include reviewing, analyzing, and updating all mortgage loan documents for accuracy and compliance with Federal and state law (50 states and the District of Columbia).
  • Monitor state and Federal laws and regulations for changes, disseminate pertinent information to peers, and ensure affected documents and packages are properly managed and updated.
  • Maintain document files and document library.
  • Research and analyze for necessary additions or changes to company policies and procedures, to ensure they are in compliance with applicable state and Federal laws and regulations.
  • Respond to compliance and compliance research questions by various business departments.
  • Responsible for identifying and driving changes that will be necessary to ensure continuous improvement within the production and operation process.

What You Will Need:

  • Undergraduate Degree.
  • Law Degree.
  • Familiarity with mortgage process and mortgage documents.
  • Will need to be highly organized to track and update documents in a timely fashion.
  • Excellent analytical ability.
  • Ability to adapt well to change.
  • Exceptional computer skills.
  • Demonstrate responsibilities for multi-faceted direction and planning; must be a fast-paced individual.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent analytical and organizational skills.
  • Detail oriented.
  • Exceptional decision making, problem-solving and strategic thinking skills required.
  • Ability to work closely within a team structure.
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Suite, specifically Word and Excel.

What We Offer:

  • Strength, Stability, and Vision.
  • A commitment to be a relevant market leader – we are aiming for the top!
  • Highly engineered proprietary technology that is revolutionizing the mortgage industry.
  • An empowered culture where your ideas are important and your voice matters.
  • Opportunity for career growth.
  • Competitive compensation package.
  • Benefits that become effective the first day of the month following your start date including – Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability Insurance and much more.
  • 401K w/ 50% match up to a maximum employee contribution of 5%- Effective the 1st of the month following 30-days of employment.
Apply for job

We are offering a unique opportunity for an Associate with a background in accounting and/or financial planning and analysis (FP&A) to join our growing financial advising company. This position is a client-facing role focusing on accounting and ERP solutions, financial consolidation, budgeting, planning, forecasting and reporting.

This Consultant will execute multiple client projects ranging from consulting services and client support, to full implementations. The successful candidate must demonstrate willingness to go the extra mile for the team's success. They will be a problem solver, creative thinker, fast learner, be detail-oriented, and interested in learning their clients' business.

What You Need for this Position

Basic Qualifications:
BS/BA in Accounting or Finance
2+ years of experience in the following financial applications/services: Adaptive Insights, Host Analytics, BI360 or other EPM Applications such as Prophix Software or Hyperion
2+ years of experience with budgeting, forecasting and financial reporting/consolidation
Strong conceptual, analytic and problem solving skills
Strong project and time management skills
Ability to work under pressure, meet deadlines and work on multiple projects simultaneously
Able and willing to travel at approximately 35% of the time

What's In It for You

Competitive salary + benefitsSo, if you are a Adaptive Planning Consultant (Full time, 100% Remote) with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

items.content:
Outpatient, IVR Facility Coder at Aviacode

Remote

Job Locations: US-Virtual/Remote

Job ID: 2019-1732

# of Openings: 1

Category: Medical Coding

Minimum Hours: 40

Overview

Now Hiring! Remote outpatient coder with cath/IVR coding experience. Must have at least 3 years coding experience and current AHIMA or AAPC certification with CIRCC credential preferred. This is a full time, 40 hours per week, employee status working remotely.

Responsibilities

  • This position will be responsible for outpatient facility Cath/IVR coding ensuring high quality and standards are met.
  • Consistent quality of 95% or higher maintained.
  • Must be available to work during normal business hours for training period, and thereafter available to work a schedule within the hours of 6 am to 9 pm CST
  • Will be responsible for providing own computer -Windows 10 professional and dual monitors.

Qualifications

  • AHIMA or AAPC credential required.
  • CIRCC preferred
  • Minimum 2 years outpatient coding experience in facility setting
  • Minimum 2 years CATH/IVR coding experience
  • Available to work full-time 40 hours per week
  • Maintain standard industry productivity rates for Inpatient coding (2 charts/hour)
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain high quality standards of 95% or greater
  • Proficient in utilizing technology (computer, VPN, MS Office, coding software) to perform responsibilities
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Must have ICD-10 coding experience and have completed an ICD-10 course

Must pass candidate assessment test with a minimum score of 85%. This position is a full-time virtual/work from home position.

items.content:
Company Summary



Join our Agency team! First American Title's Agency Division is dedicated to providing our policy-issuing agents with resources, services and underwriting guidance needed to achieve new levels of success. As a global leader in providing title insurance, settlement services and risk solutions, First American has been entrusted to protect homeownership since 1889. Don-t miss this opportunity to join the Agency team and build your career at First American Title Insurance Company (NYSE: FAF). We believe that our people are the key to the company-s continued success. Because our employees enable our future, we invest in theirs by supporting their careers and promoting their overall wellbeing. First American has created an award-winning culture and has been named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For- 2018 list for the third consecutive year and to more than 50 regional Best Places to Work lists. For more information, visit



Job Summary





Assembles title packages, searches for tax documentation or performs other research related to escrow and title closings. Assignments are varied and complex and require breadth and depth of experience. May act as a subject matter expert; can perform all the work that the unit supports; can search multiple file/product types. Acts as a resource to less experienced team members. Has broad geographic knowledge of state practices and requirements.

Travel will be required across multiple states for this position .

Essential Functions

  • Performs a wide range of title research requiring considerable judgment, independent analysis and detailed knowledge.
  • Conducts title research to compile search packages covering a wide range of complexity.
  • Creates title files and prepares endorsements and supplemental documents.
  • Investigates and interprets tax records in order to determine tax liability.
  • Creates title files, documenting all research.


Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used
  • Internet savvy
  • Strong MS skill set
  • Strong investigative, research, and problem solving skills
  • Verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of company terminology, search department procedures and tools.
  • Able to navigate company operating systems


Typical Education
  • High School diploma or equivalent; some college preferred


Typical Range of Experience
  • 3+ years related experience




First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer. For more information about our Company and our dedication to putting People First, check out firstam.com/careers.

items.content:
This Sr. Director - Information Security Risk and Compliance role has the ability to work remote from anywhere in the US. This candidate should also have some kind of security or audit certification, such as CISSP, CCSP, CISA, CISM, CIPP/US, etc.

This position is the technical leader for a business unit or an operational area within the company. This individual should be a visible leader both internal and external to Magellan. Will be included in evaluating potential mergers and acquisitions and help drive Magellan to become a global leader in using technology to deliver better outcomes to our members. Is a technologist, a think tank and visionary in the scope of the portfolio managed by assigned department. Understands strategy of other business units and exchanges best practices with the counterparts.
  • Influences changes and system enhancements to business processes, policies, and infrastructure to deliver the most effective IT services.
  • Manages the selection, evaluation, contracting and integration of externally available hardware, software, and processes to deliver business solutions.
  • Directs and manages, through analysis, the planning, design, development, testing, installation and maintenance of support systems for both internal/external clients.
  • Selects and builds strong teams through formal training, diverse assignments, coaching, mentoring, and other team development techniques, along with regular individual and group meetings.
  • Develops tactical and strategic plans to satisfy technical business needs and new business proposals.
  • Manages and develops project cost estimates, benefits, justification and assessment of potential project risks.
  • Manages projects, staff, customer expectations and business priorities to achieve customer and business unit satisfaction.
  • Manages, plans and tracks all budgets and expenses.
  • Oversees vendor relationships and projects.
  • Directs and manages business process re-engineering associated with existing, developing and implementation of systems.
  • Develops and maintains strong, cooperative relationships with other IT services groups. Shares and establishes best practices experiences and opportunities throughout the organization.
  • Applies Agile development practices in delivery of transformational programs as required.



General Job Information


Title Senior Director, Information Security Risk and Compliance (REMOTE)


Grade 32


Job Family Info Technology Group


Country United States of America


FLSA Status United States of America (Exempt)


Recruiting Start Date 6/17/2019


Date Requisition Created 5/31/2019



Work Experience IT


Education Bachelors: Information Security (Required)


License and Certifications - Required


License and Certifications - Preferred



Other Job Requirements


Responsibilities Expert level knowledge of information security publications (e.g. NIST 800-53, 53A, 37). Expert level knowledge PCI, HITRUST, and/or other industry standards.Strong consensus builder who builds credibility through targeted, accurate, and effective communication. Demonstrated ability to lead / manage direct reports, and develop staff. Demonstrated operational and technical skills relating to information security. Knowledge of security-related systems and applications, firewalls, packet analysis tools, intrusion detection/prevention, and web content filtering. Knowledge of network infrastructure, including routers, switches, firewalls. Knowledge of incident response, problem resolution, and vulnerability remediation. Knowledge of automated security testing. Ability to communicate and engage effectively with a diverse audience, including front line technical staff, non-technical staff, management, executives, and vendors/providers. Self-starter with the ability to lead tasks with demonstrated ability to work independently. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with other groups.8-10 years relevant experience.




Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled. Every employee must understand, comply and attest to the security responsibilities and security controls unique to their position.
